form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Wyden introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make investment income of certain foreign governments subject to tax.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Ending Tax Breaks for Massive Sovereign Wealth Funds Act.

section.header: Investment income of certain foreign governments subject to tax

subsection.text: Section 892(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Investment income of non-exempt foreign governments

subparagraph.text: Paragraph (1)(A)(i) shall not apply to income from investments of a non-exempt foreign government.
For purposes of this paragraph, the term non-exempt foreign government means any foreign government which—

clause.text: holds, directly or indirectly, more than $100,000,000,000 in assets for investment or for the production of income, and

subclause.text: does not have a free trade agreement in effect with the United States or an income tax treaty or convention in effect with the United States, or
is a foreign government of a covered nation (as defined in section 4872(d)(2) of title 10, United States Code).

subsection.text: Section 892(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting before the period at the end the following

paragraph.text: regulations to prevent the avoidance of the purposes of subsection (a)(4), and
regulations relating to the types of assets taken into account under subsection (a)(4)(B)(i).

subsection.header: Publication of list of non-Exempt foreign governments

paragraph.text: Not later than December 31, 2024, the Secretary of the Treasury (or the Secretary's delegate) shall publish a list of foreign governments which are non-exempt foreign governments (as defined in section 892(a)(4) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as added by this section).
The Secretary of the Treasury (or the Secretary's delegate) shall regularly update the list published under paragraph (1).
Except as provided in paragraph (2), the amendments made by this section shall apply to income received after December 31, 2023.

paragraph.header: Delay in application for income on qualified investments
paragraph.text: In the case of any qualified investment, the amendments made by this section shall apply to income received from such investment after December 31, 2025.

subparagraph.text: The term qualified investment means, with respect to a non-exempt foreign government, any investment made by such government on or before the date of the enactment of this Act the income from which would (without regard to the amendments made by this Act) be excluded from the gross income of such government under section 892 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.

subparagraph.header: Certain later investments treated as qualified investments
subparagraph.text: In the case of an investment made by a non-exempt foreign government which would be treated as a qualified investment of such government but for the fact it was made after the date of the enactment of this Act and before January 1, 2026, such investment shall be treated as a qualified investment if it—

clause.text: was made pursuant to a binding contract which—

subclause.text: was in effect on such date of enactment and at all times thereafter before such investment,
required such investment to be made on a fixed date and in a fixed amount, and
did not allow any person to delay, deny, or excuse such investment, or
a domestic corporation of which a non-exempt foreign government is a direct shareholder and which has received 1 or more qualified investments, or

a domestic or foreign partnership (or similar flow-through entity) in which a non-exempt foreign government is a direct partner and which has made 1 or more qualified investments on behalf of a non-exempt foreign government,

clause.continuation-text: receives an additional investment (which is not a qualified investment) from any non-exempt foreign government, then, notwithstanding paragraph (2), the amendments made by this section shall apply to income received from all the qualified investments received by the non-exempt foreign government from such domestic corporation or through such partnership (or similar flow-through entity) after the date on which such domestic corporation or partnership (or similar flow-through entity) receives such additional investment.

clause.text: For purposes of this subparagraph, an entity described in subclause (I) or (II) of clause (i) shall be treated as having received an additional investment from a non-exempt foreign government if—

subclause.text: it receives such investment directly from such government, or
it receives such investment from a partnership (or similar flow-through entity) of which such government is a direct or indirect partner.

clause.text: For purposes of this subparagraph, an entity shall be treated as having received additional investments described in clause (i) unless, at the time of making payments of income on any qualified investment, such entity certifies (in such manner as the Secretary of the Treasury or his delegate may prescribe) that no such additional investments have been received as of such time.

The term qualified public investment means any investment by a non-exempt foreign government in a domestic corporation or a domestic or foreign partnership which is regularly traded on an established securities market.

subclause.text: any investment in a domestic corporation on or after the date on which such non-exempt foreign government holds (directly or indirectly) 10 percent or more (by vote or value) of the total outstanding shares of stock in such domestic corporation, and

any investment in a domestic or foreign partnership on or after the date on which such non-exempt foreign government holds (directly or indirectly) 10 percent or more of the capital or profits interests of such domestic partnership.

clause.text: The term non-exempt foreign government has the meaning given such term under section 892(a)(4) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (as added by this section).
The term investment means an investment described in section 892(a)(1)(A)(i) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
